content.description:
Obvious seam, cliff left, that leads straight up the pillar and over a small overhang.

The first half of the route is mellow. The crux is pulling the roof. The last half mellows out again.

Gear options are plentiful but only as good as the rock. Luckily, there is a bolted anchor from which to Top Rope. This line is quite fun and could be a great route with some traffic to clean off some of the choss rock.
content.protection:
NC trad rack. Fixed Anchor (bolted)

Great protection options but rock quality is non-inspiring... personal rule of thumb is 'don't test it on purpose'. A little more traffic will clean up the route. Top Roping is an option available to those willing to scrabble up the backside to set it up.
content.location:
Cliff right on the Pinky Pillar frontside.

Look for the obvious seam leading up the cliff face.

Rappel down the backside off the chains.

content.description:
Crack feature. left of When In Doubt Pinkies Out.   Two options leading to the meat of the climb, both fairly mellow, but the cliff left choice offers more protection.  Technical crux, but less stressful on top rope.

This is a fun route and will clean up nicely with more traffic.  Jug fest.
content.protection:
NC trad rack.  Mixed anchor; old rusted bolt, probably better off with an all natural anchor.

Protection options are plentiful, but only as good as the rock.  Sew it up.
content.location:
Tea For Two is cliff left of When In Doubt Pinkies Out.

Rappel off Escape Of The Gumbies on Pinky Pillar backside.
